description: UAE requires visa renewal applications to be submitted at least 90 days before expiry. Late submissions may result in fines of AED 100/day and potential deportation orders.
EU work permits in Malta must be renewed 60 days before expiry. Failure to renew results in automatic work authorization suspension.
Malaysian Work Permit B1 must be renewed at least 30 days before expiry. Overstay penalties apply at MYR 500/day.
Safety training certification is mandatory for ALL employees regardless of role. Expired safety certs mean the employee cannot access office premises.
Anti-Money Laundering certification is MANDATORY for Finance and Compliance department staff. Lapsed AML certs trigger regulatory reporting obligations and potential license risk.
UAE local authorities require valid fire safety certification for all operations staff. Non-compliance can result in facility shutdown orders.
Security tokens (RSA/hardware keys) must be returned immediately upon expiry. Unreturned security devices constitute a cybersecurity breach requiring incident reporting.
IT equipment (laptops, monitors) has a 14-day grace period after return_due date before escalation to asset recovery.
Regulatory Compliance Level 2 certification is required for all Compliance department staff. Lapsed certification means the employee cannot perform compliance audit functions.
HR Compliance certification is required for all HR department staff. Without valid certification, HR staff cannot process sensitive employee data or handle disciplinary matters.
